messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: For people who post from the website...
messages.msgSnippet: My emails are taking an eternity to get posted and I have no AOL.
messages.messageBody:
My emails are taking an eternity to get posted and I have no AOL.

On Sunday, October 19, 2003, at 08:22 AM, amycats2@... wrote:

> I'm having a lot of trouble getting any email from my Yahoo groups.
> Yahoo
> says my email address is bouncing and that AOL isn't receiving emails
> from
> Yahoo. (Sigh) I'm getting a few today so hopefully it's fixed!
> Amy

Amy

messages.subject: Re: For people who post from the website...
messages.msgSnippet: mine is hotmail, and I have 2 megabytes, and I ve gotten really close to overdoing it, in the past, with a quite a bit slower list that does come to my email.
messages.messageBody:
mine is hotmail, and I have 2 megabytes, and I've gotten really close
to overdoing it, in the past, with a quite a bit slower list that
does come to my email. Like "we're sending them back, because you're
too close to your limit"

now, I hope THIS one goes...

(free)

any limits. I liked the ability to sign on to the internet just long

how many emails I received.

messages.subject: Re: For people who post from the website...
messages.msgSnippet: Yahoo just started glitching like this a few days ago. Hopefully, they will have it fixed soon.  In the meantime- type your email, copy & paste the reply into
messages.messageBody:
Yahoo just started glitching like this a few days ago.
Hopefully, they will have it fixed soon. In the meantime-
type your email, copy & paste the reply into post.
Be sure to copy the Subject line and add your own re:
if needed.

It seems to only happen when you click on reply.

Vicky


--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Heidi"
<bunsofaluminum60@h...> wrote:
anyone else having this problem?
when I want to respond to a specific post, I click on "reply" and
get a reply dialogue box, and type in my eloquent, pithy, wise
comments
LOL
then click "send"
then get a "Can't access this page" page.
When I post directly to the messages, not as a reply but as my
own post (a la "to tia")...it goes through okay.

help? I CAN'T do this list on my email, it'd fry my minimal (free)
KB's for sure, as much as you folks like to POST around here :) I
gotta get on via the website, not email.
so, whaddoo I do?
thanks
Heidi C

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] For people who post from the website...
messages.msgSnippet: I m not smart enough to know how to fix your problem, but until you find out, could you copy and paste the post you re responding to your e-mail write screen
messages.messageBody:
I'm not smart enough to know how to fix your problem, but until you find
out, could you copy and paste the post you're responding to your e-mail
write screen and go from there?

Not as convenient as having your reply automatically addressed but you'd
get the benefits of spell check that way.

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] For people who post from the website...
messages.msgSnippet: ... KB s for sure, as much as you folks like to POST around here :) I gotta get on via the website, not email I used free juno internet/email for a long
messages.messageBody:
>>>>help? I CAN'T do this list on my email, it'd fry my minimal (free)
KB's for sure, as much as you folks like to POST around here :) I
gotta get on via the website, not email>>>>>

I used free juno internet/email for a long time and never exceeded any limits. I liked the ability to sign on to the internet just long enough to download email, then I could read and write email at my leisure while off-line. I know this list gets busy sometimes, but I can't imagine it exceeding any limits. In fact, the limits I did have with juno related to how much time I could spend on-line, not how many emails I received.

What is your KB limit? The email of yours that I'm replying to was 4 KB.

Mary Ellen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
